frameDefinitions: An Asset, the safety of which is desirable, is protected from damage by a covering, the Armor.
The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
This frame concerns entities conventionally being referred to by particular names.
A Shopper looks for Goods in order to purchase them.
A Communicator or Medium assigns linguistic meaning to an Unresolved_referent thereby identifying the specific actor or entity which fulfills the answer to this question.
A Communicator or Medium briefly references something in a Message, in which only a subpart of the full content is profiled.
frameExamples: They were wearing nothing but primitive wooden <t><fex name='Armor'>armor</fex></t>.
She <t>walked</t> along the road for a while.
Can you <t>name</t> all the U.S. Presidents?
The General Secretary <t>mentions</t> some of them in his report.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Armor</fen> prevents the <fen>Asset</fen> from coming to harm.
An object or situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
Something desirable which might be lost or damaged and which is protected by <fen>Armor</fen>.
<fen>Self_mover</fen> is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument.

<fen>Source</fen> is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion.
In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion.  With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<fen>Path</fen> is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>.  This includes 'middle of path'' expressions.
<fen>Goal</fen> is used for any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up as a result of the motion.

<fen>Area</fen> is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.  Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the <fen>Place</fen> FE.
The direction that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> heads in during the motion.
The time when the motion occurs.

The <fen>Place</fen> is the location within which a defined motion takes place.  Any specified or implied  <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> should designate a location contained with the <fen>Place</fen>.  This role can be differentiated from <fen>Area</fen> by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets.
<fen>Name</fen> identifies the linguistic expression used to refer to Entities.
The <fen>Entity</fen> is the person the speaker intends to refer to by using a particular name.
The person who attempts to find the <fen>Goods</fen>.
This is the entity that the Ground may contain. Typically, it is expressed as a<ment>for</ment>-PP.
This role identifies the time when the shopping occurs.
A spatial setting larger than the Ground in which the Shopping event occurs.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey the <fen>Unresolved_referent</fen> to another person.
The thing to which the <fen>Communicator</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> refers for identification purposes.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Unresolved_referent</fen> is conveyed.
When the the <fen>Communicator</fen> is makes the indication.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> indicates the <fen>Unresolved_referent</fen>.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The relevant entity or state-of-affairs that the <fen>Communicator</fen> mentions.
When the the <fen>Message</fen> is mentioned.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates the <fen>Message</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Metal <fex>armor</fex> was so heavy that sometimes knights found it difficult to move.
The <fex>anti-mine</fex> armor being developed by the army is still months from completion.
Our company's <fex>tank</fex> armor provides an unprecedented about of protection.
The cat ran <fex>out of the house</fex>.
You should walk <fex>south</fex> about a block .
The hitchhikers walked <fex>in the middle of the road</fex>.
The children were shopping for gifts for their parents <fex>before Christmas</fex>.
<fex>When this is resolved</fex>, I will name the winner.
A CBS report did mention <fex>that the First Lady was required to wear a flak jacket for her safety</fex>.
<fex>The report</fex> also mentioned contamination problems during the manufacture.
If someone mentions <fex>things like ration books</fex> , my stomach turns.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Gay Sports Personality of the Decade'

Young Persons Champion for Pride Cymru
the South Wales Gay Men's Chorus
the Royal Electrical and Mechanical Engineers
the United Nations Periodic Review of Human Rights
the UK Lesbian and Gay Immigration Group
Week In Week Out and Eye on Wales
the Wales Alliance for Mental Health
Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender Advisory Group
the Writers' Guild of Great Britain Awards 2016
